description: RPwD Act, 2016 hiked PwD quota to 4%, but less than 1.2% of Central government employees are disabled; DoPT data does not clarify whether all these PwD employees were hired for reserved posts only

title: They partied together, leaked raids: How 11 Bengaluru cops shielded drug peddlers
description: Bengaluru police have suspended eleven personnel, including an inspector, for allegedly protecting drug peddlers. An investigation revealed a nexus between officers from Chamarajpet and JJ Nagar police stations and a drug gang led by Salman alias Paapa. The officers allegedly received protection money, provided legal assistance, and leaked information about raids.

title: Charlie Kirk | Death of a culture crusader
description: The American right-wing activist, who was killed in Utah on September 10, had promoted conservatism in a Trumpist avatar, creating a heady cocktail of MAGA populism and Christian nationalism that he showcased through public debates with campus liberals

title: Anti-terror techs set to be Quad priority
description: Despite summit uncertainties, Quad nations are actively pursuing counterterrorism efforts, including workshops addressing drone misuse and the exploitation of emerging technologies by terrorists. India acknowledges US commitment to the Quad, even amidst evolving US-China relations. The group will also launch its Ports of the Future Partnership, highlighting ongoing cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Residents demand speedy completion of bridge projects
description: Delays in the construction of bridges have resulted in various civic issues, such as sewage overflow, and affected monsoon preparedness in city neighbourhoods, they complain

title: Ensure dignified living in beggar homes: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has directed states and UTs to improve living conditions in beggar homes, ensuring dignified shelter, regular health check-ups, and nutritious food. The court also mandated vocational training for self-reliance and emphasized safety and childcare for women inmates. The Centre has been tasked with framing model guidelines for uniform implementation within three months.

title: Villagers threaten indefinite protest if UER-II toll tax not abolished
Hull vs Injury: Painful ankle update shocks fans — Queen City setback
description: Charley Hull revealed at the Kroger Queen City Championship that she tore a ligament in her ankle after a fall. Despite the injury, she's impressively tied for second place, just two shots behind the leader. Hull's strong performance comes amidst a busy schedule, including recent high finishes at the AIG Women’s Open and the Aramco Houston Championship.

title: Mohali: GMADA issues 45 clearance certificates at special camp, addresses residents’ grievances

description: Rajasthan Deputy CM Diya Kumari said new policies were being implemented to promote concert tourism, destination weddings and meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions tourism in the State

title: 'My brain is worth Rs 200 crore': Nitin Gadkari amid ethanol row
description: Amidst criticism surrounding the ethanol program, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari asserted his integrity and financial independence, stating his work is driven by a desire to improve farmers' lives, particularly in Vidarbha, where farmer suicides are a concern.

title: National Lok Adalat in Chandigarh: Husband and wife living separately for past 10 years reunited, custody of eight-year-old settled
The long and short of it
description: George Kerr Anderson was an American inventor and tinkerer who spent a lifetime making improvements to devices – from lengthening the words that could be typed with a typewriter before its ribbon had to be changed, to creating standalone shorthand machines. A.S.Ganesh tells you more about a man and his machines, both of which are now mostly forgotten…

Despite some Bengals players listed with injuries, Burrow is reported to be fully fit and focused on securing another win.

Modi met displaced families, reaffirming the government's commitment to peace.

title: Special trap cages to be deployed near forests to curb intrusion of wild boars
description: Under this approach, the captured animals will be released within 3 km of forest boundaries, keeping them close to their natural habitat while reducing crop damage in nearby farmland

title: Richardson vs Jackson: 100m heat thriller at World Championships
description: Sha'Carri Richardson edged out Shericka Jackson in a thrilling 100m heat at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, clocking 11.03 seconds. Jackson finished a close second at 11.04 seconds. Australia's Torrie Lewis secured third place with 11.08 seconds, setting a new national record. This victory fuels Richardson's confidence as she prepares for the semi-finals, continuing her rivalry with Jackson.

title: Tamil Nadu produces the most number of engineers in the country, says Deputy CM

10 Kuki-Zo MLAs submit memorandum to Modi on UT demand
description: During Prime Minister Modi's visit to Manipur, ten Kuki-Zo MLAs, including seven from the BJP, submitted a memorandum urging the Centre to expedite dialogue for a separate Union Territory with a legislature. Citing ethnic cleansing and displacement, they asserted that separation is necessary for peace and security. The Kuki-Zo Council echoed this demand, emphasizing it as a necessity for survival.

SC dismisses NUJS's sexual harassment complaint; orders VC to mention judgment in resume
description: The Supreme Court dismissed a sexual harassment complaint against the NUJS Vice-Chancellor, citing a delay in filing beyond the POSH Act's limitation period. While the court acknowledged the delayed complaint, it directed that the judgment be included in the Vice-Chancellor's resume. This unusual directive serves as a permanent record of the allegations, despite their dismissal on procedural grounds.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
description: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO
description: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: ‘That wasn’t even a moment’: Fans slam NFL over Charlie Kirk tribute; sparks outrage
description: The NFL and Green Bay Packers honored Charlie Kirk with a moment of silence before facing the Washington Commanders. Fans called it rushed and poorly executed, slamming the league for inconsistency compared to past public statements. Kirk, 31, was killed Wednesday in Utah. The tribute came as Trump vowed to award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Utah tragedy: Patrick Mahomes silent after Kirk shooting; Randi, Tavia speak out
description: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.
